content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Haoyu Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Hello Mr. Wang, glad to meet you. I must say, you have a keen eye for quality. This apartment is indeed a gem, located in the heart of the city, with all amenities within reach. I'm sure you can see the potential. Now, let's talk business. I'm thinking of renting this place out for, say, 1500 Euro per month. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I see, Mr. Schmidt. The apartment is indeed well-located and of good quality. However, I am a student and I am looking for something more affordable. How about 900 Euro per month?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Ah, I see. Well, Mr. Wang, I must say you're a tough negotiator. I can appreciate that. However, I'm afraid I can't go that low. The market rate for a place like this is around 1200 Euro per month, and I can't really go below that. It's not that I don't want to help you out, it's just that I have expenses too, you know? But I'll tell you what, I'll meet you halfway. How about we say 1050 Euro per month? That's the best I can do. What do you say?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I appreciate your understanding, Mr. Schmidt. 1050 Euro is still a bit high for me. How about 1000 Euro per month?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content:
Mr. Wang, you're a hard negotiator, I'll give you that. But I'm afraid I can't go that low. The apartment is worth more than that, and I can't afford to rent it out for such a low price. I've already lowered the price quite a bit, and I'm not sure I can go any further.

But tell you what, I'll throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. How about I include the utilities in the rent? That's a savings of at least 100 Euro per month for you. And I'll also provide you with a brand new kitchen appliance package, worth over 1000 Euro. That's a great deal, if I do say so myself.

So, what do you say? Is 1050 Euro per month, with utilities included and a new appliance package, a fair price for this apartment?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That sounds like a reasonable deal, Mr. Schmidt. I agree to the price of 1050 Euro per month!
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content:
Excellent! I'm glad we could come to an agreement, Mr. Wang. I'll just need to draw up the rental agreement and we can finalize everything.

But before we do that, I want to make sure we're on the same page. You're aware that the apartment is unfurnished, correct? And you'll be responsible for paying your own utilities?

Also, I want to remind you that the security deposit is 2000 Euro. This will be refundable at the end of your tenancy, provided there's no damage to the apartment.

Finally, I need to inform you that I have a strict no-pets policy. I'm sure you understand, but I wanted to make it clear.

Now, let's get started on the rental agreement. I'll need some personal information from you, such as your full name, address, and contact details. And I'll also need to see your proof of income and employment.

Once we have everything in order, we can sign the agreement and you can move in. How does that sound?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That sounds perfect, Mr. Schmidt. I'm looking forward to moving in. Here is my personal information and my proof of income and employment.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content:
Great, Mr. Wang! I'm glad you're excited about the apartment. Let me just take a look at your documents real quick.

Hmm, everything seems to be in order. I see you work at a tech company in the city, and you make a good salary. That's great. And your credit score is excellent, so I don't see any issues there.

Just one more thing, Mr. Wang. As you know, I'm a bit of a stickler for the rules. I need to remind you that the rent is due on the first of the month, and late fees will be applied if it's not paid on time. And of course, you're responsible for keeping the apartment clean and tidy.

But I'm sure you're a responsible tenant, and I don't expect any problems. Let me just grab the keys and we can do a quick walk-through of the apartment before you move in.

Oh, and one more thing. I hope you don't mind, but I do have a few rules for the apartment. No smoking, no loud music after 10 PM, and no guests staying overnight without my permission. Just want to make sure we have a peaceful and respectful living environment.

What do you say, Mr. Wang? Are you ready to move in and start your new life in this beautiful apartment?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand and agree to your rules, Mr. Schmidt. I look forward to moving in and being a respectful and responsible tenant.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content:
Wonderful, Mr. Wang! I'm glad we have an understanding. Let's do the walk-through now, and then you can pick up the keys and move in whenever you're ready.

As we walk through the apartment, I'll point out a few things. The living room is spacious, with large windows that let in plenty of natural light. The kitchen is fully equipped, with modern appliances and plenty of counter space. And the bedroom is cozy, with a comfortable-sized bed and plenty of closet space.

I'm sure you'll be happy here, Mr. Wang. And like I said, I'm always available if you have any questions or concerns. Just give me a call or send me an email, and I'll be there to help.

Now, let's head to the front door. I'll give you a set of keys, and you can move in whenever you're ready. Welcome to your new home, Mr. Wang!
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
